page.title: 08INDUSTRY IN DENHOLME
page.content: {Denholme Velvets}employ l27 people, producing 25,000 metres of velvet, cotton and man-made each week. Some yarn is imported and 66% of goods are exported to over 30 countries. A{joinery firm}(also kitchen design), employing 120 people, make and supply 400 units a week. Their purchasers include the Metropolitan Council. The old mill houses two firms dealing mainly with {waste synthetic materials They sort, repack and export all over the world. A {timber yard}, on the site of the old railway station, buys wood in bulk and resells in smaller quantities. There are two {bakeries},one at Keelham, making 6,000 loaves a week, supplying 9 shops, and a smaller one at Denholme. Other industry includes an {abattoir}, { garages},small businesses and shops.
